correctness.rationale: Multiple inaccuracies and schema issues. Major problems: (1) Pressure: value 1.96 mmHg is incorrect and not the reactor pressure; 1.96 mbar reported in the article is a DEZ partial pressure (≈1.47 mmHg), while the process is atmospheric SALD. Correct to atmospheric pressure and avoid confusing partial pressures. (2) Growth-per-cycle: reported as ~0.18 nm/cycle for ZnO; extraction uses 0.18 Å (10× too small). Should be ~1.8 Å with ANGSTROM unit. (3) Film thickness: 60 nm after 1400 cycles corresponds to InZnO, not IGZO; the IGZO used for TFTs is 15 nm. The process mixes conditions from different films. (4) Flow rates: set to 0.0 sccm for all species; no such values are reported and zeros are nonphysical. Remove or leave unspecified per schema intent; do not fabricate. (5) SupercycleDesign: a 1:1:1 subcycle sequence is not described; growth is by coinjection in SALD. (6) Material properties: many placeholder/zero values (refractiveIndex, absorption, bandGap, resistivity, carrierDensity, mobility, uniformity, conformality, roughness, filmDensity) are unsupported and likely invalid; should be omitted or populated only if reported. (7) Film composition atomicRatio method: composition percentages (In 20%, Ga 8%) were measured by EDX; extraction labels XPS. (8) Plasma power set to None violates schema; SALD is thermal—omit plasmaPower object. (9) PurgingGas: SALD uses no time-sequenced purges; article does not specify a purging gas—setting Argon as purgingGas is unsupported. (10) Pressure unit/value mismatch and misuse of partial pressure versus reactor pressure violates schema semantics. Properties to correct/review: pressure, growthPerCycle, filmThickness, flowRates, supercycleDesign, materialProperties fields with zeros, filmComposition.characterizationMethod, plasmaPower, purgingGas, and coherence of parameters to a single IGZO process instance.

completeness.rationale: Multiple issues limit completeness and schema compliance. (1) Missing processes: the article describes separate depositions of ZnO, InZnO, and IGZO (and IGZO variants with different In/Ga contents for TFTs), but only one process object is provided. (2) Schema violations/placeholders: plasmaPower is set to null (must be absent or a valid object); many fields use “Not Found” or 0.0 (optical/electrical properties, uniformity, conformality, roughness, density, flowRates), which are not traceable to the article and violate the no-empty/placeholder expectation. (3) Incorrect/unsupported values: pressure is incorrectly set from DEZ partial pressure (1.96 mbar) and with a mismatched unit (mmHg); reactor pressure should be atmospheric. GPC is reported as 0.18 Å/cycle but should be 0.18 nm/cycle (i.e., 1.8 Å/cycle to satisfy the schema unit). Film thickness and cycles (60 nm after 1400 cycles) refer to a specific In-rich InZnO case, not the IGZO TFT sample, which is 15 nm; this creates inconsistency. SupercycleDesign is populated, but the article used coinjection rather than supercycles, so this section is not applicable. Flow rates are set to 0 sccm with no support in the article (only partial pressures are given). Saturation is set to false without support; ZnO shows ALD-mode behavior. (4) Composition reporting: elementalConcentration is 0%, and atomicRatio 20:8:72 is attributed to XPS, whereas the composition values cited (In 20%, Ga 8%) come from EDX; method should be corrected and values filled. (5) Device metrics: on/off ratio and subthreshold swing are set to zero, but not reported in the article; they should be omitted or supported. (6) Other aspects: bias stability is discussed in the article, but filmStability is left null. To improve completeness, add distinct process entries (ZnO, InZnO, IGZO with reported compositions), correct pressure (atmospheric), fix GPC units, remove or correctly populate supercycleDesign, replace fabricated zeros with traceable values or omit optional sections, provide composition via EDX, set IGZO film thickness to 15 nm for the TFT process, and capture bias stability in otherAspects.
